Reviews.Title: “A good place to park the in-laws when they're in town.”
Reviews.Author: CABOSANPLANO
Reviews.Content: This is just several blocks from my house so whenever my in-laws come to town, I get them a room or rooms here. It's a no-frills, clean hotel in a safe area so my I pick them up in the morning and after spending all day at our house or running around in DFW, I drop them back off in the evening so my wife & and and my in-laws can both have some privacy at night.. I love my in-laws and they love me but after a full day together, I think we all agree that the inexpensive rooms are more than worth the price. After all, it's just a place for them to sleep before we do the "family thing" again the next day. I'd also recommend it for business travelers that are just looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep instead of a place to entertain clients.

Reviews.Title: “I love Priceline...”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: ...because I end up in hotels like this. This is a very well-managed HI Express property and I was happy to have gotten this for an excellent rate on Priceline. Staff Uniformly excellent...some a little more friendlier than others, but always had good information and took care of any questions I had (especially regarding billing...I had pre-paid through priceline but still got a bill slipped under my door with the priceline account info on it...reception assured me no problem). Receptionist even got me to sign up for reward program. Room Large room, decent bathroom, walk-in shower. Large desk (always good for business travel). High bed (which I really like) and nice firm (but not hard) mattress. My only complaint is that the TV system (dish) is way more complicated than it needs to be. Accidentally ended up off network twice and had to fiddle with the TV itself to get back on. microwave and mini-fridge rounds out the room. I was in room 217 so on the back side about three doors away from elevator. I heard occasional foot traffic, but no traffic noise or trains that others talked about, so being on the back side of the hotel does make a difference. Housekeeping Uniformly excellent. vacuumed and cleaned every day. very clean bathroom. the only oddity was that my ice bag was never replaced. Location Very convenient, right off I-30, if no traffic, 12-minute drive to downtown. Located across from a mall with a wide-range of dining options and a WalMart so you could pretty much get whatever you needed across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel about 6 miles west of downtown Dallas for 4 nights in Jan. 2012. Fairly clean, quiet king "suite" on 4th floor. Bed was comfortable; small fridge in room was adequate; wifi worked well in room. Plenty of hot water in the shower, tub and sink. Breakfast was typical of Holiday Inns - medicore. Indoor hot tub was not working correctly during my entire stay. Worth about $79-$109. per night, depending on day of week.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean, efficient stay”
Reviews.Author: gkace
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian family and were looking for a place to stay for our 3 days in Dallas. This place we found at under $100 and would the best value for money place we have ever stayed. It was super clean and well located to all attractions of both Dallas and Fort Worth. We usual visit 5 star hotels and don't believe it warranted the price difference given the little time we were here and in our rooms. We booked a double suite but they end up giving us connecting rooms as they were over booked. It also is well located across the road to a mini outdoor shopping area. Beds are comfy and breakfast is very basic but enough. I would recommend asking for a room facing away from main road and not on ground floor (where we were) as there can be some noise. All in all would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Homewardbound12
Reviews.Content: Nice, newer, hotel with friendly staff. The hotel is in a good location close to restuarants, gas stations, etc. Breakfast was "ok", but otherwise the accommodations were nice, clean, and spacious. The bed was slightly uncomfortable, otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Location great for Big Events!!”
Reviews.Author: Fayettenam
Reviews.Content: Headed to Southwest Classic(Arkansas vs TX A&M), stayed one quick night. Exceeded my expectations. Everything seems very nice and new. All ammenities seemed great! Used the fitness center, was great! The continental breakfast, was not only large, but very well maintained. Will stay here again, anytime I am headed to sporting event (Cowboys, Rangers, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Best Around”
Reviews.Author: LSUGalJones
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled into town for a football game. We had a reservation at another Holiday Inn (Arlington) but they had cancelled our reservation and had no room for us, so 500 miles away from home with nowhere to sleep, we were told this hotel had one room left for the weekend and was the only one within a 30 mile radius, so we decided to take the room. Best decision ever! We arrived here and couldn't have asked for a better location, hotel, or staff experience. Valmarie is great! Staff is very friendly and professional, rooms are clean and good value for the money. I highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay in the Dallas/Arlington area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST at EVERYTHING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ted J
Reviews.Content: Relax, the staff there will truly and compassionately tend to any and all of your needs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall - some staffing issues”
Reviews.Author: lilmoonie
Reviews.Content: My family and I took a trip up to Dallas to visit the JFK museum and shop at the Galleria. We chose this Holiday Inn because it seemed pretty nice, the price was right, and we wanted free breakfast. It wasn't as close as we wanted to be, but it wasn't too far of a drive either. Five of us stayed in a queen suite and the room was spacious and nice. The only complaint I have is that the night we stayed there seemed to be a staffing issue as there were A LOT of military guys staying there and only one person working the front desk. There weren't enough towels in the room and when I went downstairs to request some (I had to go downstairs because no one was answering the front desk phone) I was told they were out and that housekeeping would bring some up in the morning (they didn't). The one woman that was there was doing her best, but it was obvious she was overwhelmed. That was frustrating, but overall, we had a nice stay and would consider staying here again. There is a Walmart right across the street and several fast food places nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: lsmith6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Express & Suites Dallas West, 4321 Communications Drive Dallas Texas every weekend starting April 14, 2011 through July 10, 2011 and it was almost like being at home. I was always welcomed with a smile and had all request taken care of in a timely manner. I recommended this Holiday Inn Express & Suites to my co-workers and all had a pleasant stay. I will be staying at this hotel whenever I am in the West Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodations & services”
Reviews.Author: 129teen40
Reviews.Content: The entire staff, especially Valmarie, treated us as if they wanted us to be there. We liked their attention to detail in keeping our room clean and tidy. We chose this particular hotel to accomodate us for a medical and pleasure visit. We were not disappointed one bit. We are Priority Club members and our stay reinforced our decision that Holdiy Inn is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed with the professionalism of the staff and the cleanliness and amenties offered.”
Reviews.Author: CMac23
Reviews.Content: As a Recruiting Coordinator for a D1 Baseball program searching for a hotel in West Dalllas, I was fortunate to come across Dallas West as I no prior knowledge of its whereabouts, etc. The professionalism and courtesy of the staff was very much appreciated, and the cleanliness of the rooms and amenities offered made for a very manageable and pleasureable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Simmrouter
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the Holiday Inn Express Dallas West recently, and I must say that it was probably the best hotel in the entire Holiday Inn Express chain! I arrived around 6:45 PM in time to enjoy the "Manager's Reception" which included beer, wine and a few appetizers. The upgraded room was very clean and comfortable, and the buffet breakfast was delicious. I also needed to print out some large business documents which was no problem in the well stocked business center next to the main lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers. There is also a Chili's Restaurant within easy walking distance if you need dinner or a drink. I plan to stay at this Holiday Inn Express Hotel whenever I have business in either Dallas or Fort Worth as it is conveniently located just off of I-30 which runs between these two major cities in Texas.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Dallas West
HotelInfo.Address: 4231 Communications Drive, Dallas, TX 75211
